intro: Eremostachys angreni, commonly known as the Angren stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in dry environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically during the summer months. Its compact growth habit and ability to survive in poor soil conditions make it a hardy ornamental plant. Eremostachys angreni is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low maintenance requirements.
